sources.name: Gapminder (child mortality estimates version 8)
sources.description:
Description:

Data published by

Gapminder.org
Data publisher's source Several sources were used: 
CME info estimates
Human Mortality Database
Estimated from Gapminder's IMR series.
Data extrapolated back to 1800 based on Gapminder Life Expectancy combined with model life tables.
Particularly, the earlier data for many  countries are "guesstimates" by the data publishers at Gapminder.org and come with a large uncertainty. 
Link http://www.gapminder.org/data/documentation/gd005/
Retrieved 22 May 2016
Link http://www.gapminder.org/data/documentation/gd005/
Retrieved 22 May 2016
Additional information
Link http://www.gapminder.org/data/documentation/gd005/
Retrieved 22 May 2016
The probability that a child born in a specific year will die before reaching the age of five if subject to current age-specific mortality rates. Expressed as a rate per 1,000 live births.
Link http://www.gapminder.org/data/documentation/gd005/
Retrieved 22 May 2016
This is Version 8 of the data set uploaded by Gapminder on 2015 October 18
 
 
The World series for 1800 to 1960 was calculated by Max Roser on the basis of the Gapminder estimates of child mortality and the Gapminder series on population by country. For each estimate in that period a population weighted global average was calculated.
The recent annual observations of the World series (1960 and later) is taken from the World Bank (http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SH.DYN.MORT).
